Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; white slip; interior glazed streaky brown (fired red-brown in parts); from top, row of dots in faded added white above white band; lotus buds and tendrils in faded white outline with centre in added red; exterior: painted decoration consisting perhaps of lion (part of underbelly and one foreleg remaining) to right; below, band of alternating vertical and horizontal strokes between pairs of dilute lines.
Curator's comments: In the Chalice Style, lions are usually depicted facing right and sphinxes left.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1943) (phase 2)
